aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Accident Information
The accident involved maneuvering during a simulated/training event.
The defining event of the accident was controlled flight into terrain/object (CFIT).
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot was 24 years old.
The pilot had an airplane rating for single-engine land.
The pilot occupied the left seat.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot had no instrument rating.
No second pilot was present during the accident.
The pilot had no instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 3 medical certification without waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on December 1, 2011.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on June 25, 2012.
The pilot had 72 hours of total flight time across all aircraft.
The pilot had 8 hours of total flight time in this make and model.
The pilot had 30 hours as Pilot In Command across all aircraft.
The pilot had 8 hours of flight time in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 5 hours of flight time in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 2 hours of flight time in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.
The aircraft was a Cessna 152.
The aircraft registration was N757GX.
The aircraft category was Airplane.
The aircraft had a Normal airworthiness certificate.
The aircraft serial number was 15279739.
The aircraft had tricycle landing gear.
The aircraft had 2 seats.
The aircraft's last inspection was a 100-hour inspection on March 31, 2013.
The aircraft's certified maximum gross weight was 1670 lbs.
The aircraft had 1 reciprocating engine.
The aircraft's airframe had 10068 total hours at the time of the accident.
The aircraft had an Emergency Locator Transmitter (ELT) installed but not activated.
The engine manufacturer was LYCOMING.
The engine model/series was 0-235 SERIES.
The engine was rated at 110 Horsepower.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight

Maneuvering | Simulated/training event
--- | ---
Maneuvering | Controlled flight into terr/obj (CFIT) (Defining event)

## Pilot Information

Certificate: | Private
--- | ---
Age: | 24
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 
Instrument Rating(s): | None
Second Pilot Present: | No
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 3 Without waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | December 1, 2011
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | June 25, 2012
Flight Time: | 72 hours (Total, all aircraft), 8 hours (Total, this make and model), 30 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 8 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 5 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

## Aircraft and Owner/Operator Information

Aircraft Make: | Cessna
--- | ---
Registration: | N757GX
Model/Series: | 152
Aircraft Category: | Airplane
Year of Manufacture: | 
Airworthiness Certificate: | Normal
Serial Number: | 15279739
Landing Gear Type: | Tricycle
Seats: | 2
Date/Type of Last Inspection: | March 31, 2013 100 hour
Certified Max Gross Wt.: | 1670 lbs
Time Since Last Inspection: | Engines: 1 Reciprocating
Airframe Total Time: | 10068 Hrs at time of accident
ELT: | Installed, not activated
Engine Manufacturer: | LYCOMING
Registered Owner: | On file
Engine Model/Series: | 0-235 SERIES
Operator: | On file
Rated Power: | 110 Horsepower
Operating Certificate(s) Held: | None

---
